fields.description:
Sometime the user may have confused the 'Create or Add to Review' menu item under Source -> <Repository> -> <file_name> -> Source tab -> Reviews -> Create or Add to Review.

The user may would like to add the file to review but it somehow creates a new review after clicking on the 'Create or Add to Review' link. Hence, it would be good to have a documentation that covers:
* Example steps to add the file to review
* The criteria to make the file being added to a review
fields.summary: Lack of documentation of the 'Create or Add to Review' menu item

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1) Create a review using light scm. 
2) Click on the link for the changeset (see screenshot). 
3) Link points to something like this: [http://127.0.0.1/foo/changelog/Mine/?cs=12]
4) Get error like 

{noformat}
The requested resource cannot be found.
no such repository - Mine

Referer:
    http://127.0.0.1/foo/cru/CR-5 
{noformat}
fields.summary: Disable links to changesets in reviews for lightSCM plugins

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Select a file/diff with short source lines or adjust the browser width so that there is lots of whitespace between the rightmost edge of the source and the right side of the viewport.
2. Click on a source line to create an inline comment.

Expected:
- comment edit form pops up.

Actual:
- comment edit form pops up.
- the tetris, line number, and diff marker columns expand, throwing the alignment of the unifed diff out (see the screen shots).

The diff alignment is still broken after:
- immediately posting the inline comment, and
- page reload.
fields.summary: inline comments break diff rendering when source lines are short

in the tools menu:

"Create Blank Review" -> "Create Review"
"Abandon" -> "Abandon Review"

in context menu:

"Add to review" -> "Create Review"
fields.summary: various misc wording improvements in Crucible

fields.description: After upgrading to a bigger license of Crucible, Crucible should activate all the former inactive users automatically.
fields.summary: Auto-Enabling of all inactive Crucible users when a upgrading to a bigger license

fields.description:
Currently system information does not include 

Configured db (mysql/postgres/internal). The version of the db, and the version of driver used, and some other useful information such as db url, number of connections configured in the db connection pool, etc. 

Example;

{noformat}
Database type: mssql
Database JNDI address: java:comp/env/jdbc/JiraDS
Database URL: jdbc:jtds:sqlserver://192.168.122.40:1433/JIRA_3122
Database version: 09.00.4211
Database driver: jTDS Type 4 JDBC Driver for MS SQL Server and Sybase 1.2.2 
Database Connection Pool : 15 connections
{noformat} 

While we are at, we should provide similar information if connected to external user management, such as crowd or LDAP

{noformat}
External User Management : Crowd
Crowd Version : 1.6.2
Crowd driver : crowd-integration-client-1.6.2.jar
{noformat}
fields.summary: Improve System Information to include database information

fields.description:
We maintain a database connection pool to external dbs (mysql and postgres) but we do not provide an easy way to configure the number of connections in this pool. 

This will become important for customers who have a large number of users.
fields.summary: Make the number of connections to a db easily configurable

fields.description:
Sometimes when using mysql db, reviews will start throwing:

{noformat}
2009-07-15 15:34:45,555 ERROR [btpool0-519] fisheye.app HibernateUtil-commitTransaction - Commit fail msg-0:Could not execute JDBC batch update
2009-07-15 15:34:45,556 ERROR [btpool0-519] fisheye.app HibernateUtil-commitTransaction - Commit fail msg-1:Lock wait timeout exceeded; try restarting transaction
2009-07-15 15:34:45,557 ERROR [btpool0-519] fisheye.app HibernateUtil-commitTransaction - Commit failed rolling back.
...
...
Caused by: java.sql.BatchUpdateException: Lock wait timeout exceeded; try restarting transaction
	at com.mysql.jdbc.ServerPreparedStatement.executeBatch(ServerPreparedStatement.java:647)
	at com.mchange.v2.c3p0.impl.NewProxyPreparedStatement.executeBatch(NewProxyPreparedStatement.java:1723)
	at org.hibernate.jdbc.BatchingBatcher.doExecuteBatch(BatchingBatcher.java:48)
	at org.hibernate.jdbc.AbstractBatcher.executeBatch(AbstractBatcher.java:246)
	... 163 more
{noformat}

Once it occurs it will occur increasingly. 

A restart of the fisheye will clear it up. 

From investigation of devs mysql appear to keep locks open on certain rows (though we still have not been able to reliably reproduce the issue, or isolate a cause).
fields.summary: Sometimes get "Lock wait timeout exceeded; try restarting transaction" when using Mysql db

fields.description:
This has caused at least a dozen restarts in the last week

See attached thread dump, CRU looks like its lock convoying somewhere inside infinity DB
fields.summary: Crucible fails to respond to web requests

fields.description:
*Problem #1*
The buttons at the toolbar
# Go to next comment ('n')
# Go to previous comment ('p')

are being disabled when I have added more than 1 comment inside the reviewed file. In other words, I am not able to use them to navigate between comments. However, this behavior is not consistent over the time. These button will be enabled at some point of time.


*Problem #2*
As I am using the button '+' to add a new comment (not inline comment), the count of comment on top doesn't change, but the count of comment on left panel has been changed.
fields.summary: [Comment Navigation] - Next/Previous buttons do not work as expected & Count of comment is not consistent.

fields.description:
We use the TEXT datatype for large character fields, but this only holds a maximum of 64kb of data, or 65535 non-multibyte characters (when multibyte characters are used, this could be as little as 21845 characters).

MySQL accepts any string and silently truncates it when storing.

Solution is to move to larger datatypes such as MEDIUMTEXT (holds max 2^24 = 16,777,215 bytes) or LONGTEXT (2^32 = 4,294,967,295 or 4GB).

It's important to investigate the effects this may have on our full text comment search.
fields.summary: MySQL silently truncates text fields to 64kb

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce

1) Create a new review and include some files as well a directory that has been moved, added or deleted. 
2) Create general comments for the whole review, comments for files and comments against the directory (that has been moved added or deleted)

You will see a comment count against the general comments or files but not against the directory.
fields.summary: We do not show the number of comments made against a directory like we do with general comments or files

fields.description:
[Adding Changeset To Review|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Review+Service+-+Reviews#ReviewService-Reviews-AddChangesetToReview] doesn't seem to work with repository using LightSVN plugin.

Steps to reproduce:
* Using [curl|http://curl.haxx.se/] to run the rest service. e.g add a changeset to review "CR-5"
{noformat}
curl --data @addchangeset.txt -u user:user http://127.0.0.1:8060/rest-service/reviews-v1/CR-5/addChangeset -H "Content-Type:application/xml" 
{noformat}
* The content of "addchangeset.txt" look like this:
{noformat}
<addChangeset>
<repository>lightSVN</repository>
<changesets>
<changesetData>
<id>9</id>
</changesetData>
</changesets>
</addChangeset> 
{noformat}
* Error exception is thrown, see the attached debug log

This is not reproducible using the Fisheye repository.
fields.summary: Rest API doesn't work with LightSVN plugin

fields.description: Currently, every users can view other people's LOC information via the "People" tab. It would be good to have an option to hide the per user LOC information from certain users/groups. This could be an option which is configurable by the administrator.
fields.summary: Hiding LOC information from certain Users/Groups

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Add a repository with the '/' character added at the end of the URL. For example: file:///c:/TEMP/testSVN/
2. As a result, the repository location will show double slashes. For example: file:///c:/TEMP/testSVN// 

However, this should not be a problem of the functionality of the crucible. This problem does not apply to CVS and Perforce as well. I had tested the result in svn client and svnKit, both returned me the same result. Hence, crucible should be able to retrieve all the information from the SVN repository.

For example:

{noformat}
C:\>svn info file:///c:/testSVN//
Path: testSVN
URL: file:///C:/testSVN
Repository Root: file:///C:/testSVN

fields.summary: Double slashes appended incorrectly at the end of the SVN URL

fields.description:
At the moment you need to manually link a suggested JIRA issue. I'm not 100% sure what practical difference this makes apart from a letting me click through, but I think it should be linked by default and people can unlink themselves if the link is incorrect.

Most of the time (100% so far, but there're obviously cases where JIRA issue key parsing is incorrect) the suggested link is correct and I want to link, so I think we should default to thta
fields.summary: JIRA issues should be linked by default

fields.description:
Most of the time when I close a review, I want to click through to the corresponding JIRA issue. At the moment, I wait for the light box to disappear (while the page is reloading) and click on the JIRA link due to the light box being disabled when the page is reloading)

It'd be much nicer if in the light box itself when it asks "What you wanna do now? Dashboard or close?" the other option is to go to (one of) the JIRA issue associated with the review. Just takes a step out of it.
fields.summary: Direct link to linked JIRA issue on review close dialog.

fields.description: I'm unable to delete an abandoned review - UI does nothing. Second attempt beachballs FF 3.5
fields.summary: Review Deletion is not working

fields.description: We have a code convention to replace tabs with spaces. However now and then tabs sneak in due to new developers or IDE configuration. All our code goes through crucible and the tabs can mess up display depending on the tabs with setting of the user. We would like to be able to have the tabs display as visual items like many IDE's and editors can do it so it becomes more obvious to the reviewer as well as the author and it can be fixed. (I am aware that this could be done with a checkstyle rule but we are not running checktyle .. yet)
fields.summary: Option to display tabs and other special characters

fields.description:
Currently with iterative reviews, author can go through multiple iterations during the review. 

However there is no way to track how many iterations have taken place. 

Perhaps we can add dates to when the revisions were added to the review so that it can made easier to see what revisions were added to the review at what time.
fields.summary: Be able to track the number of iterations in a review

fields.description: brendan needs to think about how to present views
fields.summary: the greying-out of avatars is insufficient indication of reviewer completeness. Lets do greying-out + a green tick overlay

fields.description:
This problem arises when there is a growing number of comments. Even though we can see how many unread comment on the left panel, but it could be a not easy way for the user to find them one by one, if the reviewed file is large & there are a lot of comments in between.

*Suggested Resolution*
# Have other 2 buttons to navigate unread comments (just like existing buttons to navigate all comments)
# Have child links for the reviewed file on left panel that point directly to the comment.
fields.summary: [Comment Navigation] - Allow easy navigation among unread comments
Implement wildcard searches

fields.description:
All of the following queries against the Atlassian private repository hit {{/benryan/textmining/src/org/apache/poi/hssf/record/formula/functions/NumericFunction.java}}:

|Filename prefix|NumericFunction.j|(/)|
|Containing directory name & filename prefix|functions/NumericFunction.j|(/)|
|Adjacent path components & filename prefix|formula/functions/NumericFunction.j|(/)|
|Non-adjacent path components & filename prefix|apache/formula/NumericFunction.j|(/)|
|Out-of-order path components & filename prefix|apache/benryan/NumericFunction.j|(/)|
fields.summary: Implement path component searches
Implement CamelCase filename searches
Implement whole filename searches

fields.description:
Priority is QuickNav, then perhaps QuickSearch.

Goals:
* Ability to manage revision insertion.
* Execute the query forms we want (Starting with path and filename matches).

Aim at this stage is validation of requirements and implementation strategies, rather than full integration with other product components.

See brainstorming at https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/FECRU/FishEye-Crucible+2.1+Search+Brainstorming
fields.summary: Spike of indexing & searching

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a user with Chinese character (e.g. user (华语)) 
2. Navigate to Reviews -> Reports

The username with Chinese character will be displayed as question mark in Reviews -> Reports page. Please see the [screenshot|screenshot.JPG]. There is no problem with other pages. The problem just lies on this particular report page.
